metadata.title: CVE-2024-27413 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:efi/capsule-loader: fix incorrect allocation sizegcc-14 notices that the allocation with sizeof(void) on 32-bitarchitecturesis not enough for a 64-bit phys_addr_t:drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c: In function 'efi_capsule_open':drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c:295:24: error: allocation ofinsufficient size '4' for type 'phys_addr_t' {aka 'long long unsigned int'}with size '8' [-Werror=alloc-size]  295 |         cap_info->phys = kzalloc(sizeof(void *), GFP_KERNEL);      |                        ^Use the correct type instead here.
